text.section: A board of directors shall meet at least annually and may hold meetings inside or outside of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Unless the organic rules provide otherwise, the board of directors may permit any or all directors to participate in a regular or special meeting by, or conduct the meeting through the use of, any means of communication by which all directors participating may simultaneously hear each other during this meeting. A director participating in a meeting by this means shall be deemed to be present in person at the meeting.

law.history: Created 2012 Ky. Acts ch. 160, sec. 64, effective July 12, 2012.
